CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 4, 1943, pg. 14, reads: "Elkdom on Parade! ... Thousands See Colorful Event ... Nation Represented. Tuesday afternoon, the Elks held their famous annual convention parade.  Up and down the hills of Pittsburgh marched the members of the Antlered Herd to the cheers and applause of thousands of spectators.  While not as long as parades in other years, it was still colorful and entertaining... - Courier Photos by Harris, Sockwell and Olmstead."
TitMainTitle: Annual Elks parade led by representatives of Masons, Shriners, police and fire officials, and armed forces officers, including Voyle Parker fourth from left, Lt. James Robinson sixth from left, and Elder Beck on right end, on Wylie Avenue, Hill District
